meanings.definition: To convince someone to do something through reasoning or argument.
meanings.sent1: She was persuading her friend to try the new restaurant by explaining how delicious the food was.
meanings.sent2: The salesman was persuading the customer to buy the latest model of the phone.
meanings.sent3: The cat was persuading the dog to share its toy by meowing sweetly.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was persuading the students to open their minds to new ideas like a gardener coaxing flowers to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The politician was persuading the voters with promises of a better future.

meanings.definition: To win someone over to a particular belief or way of thinking.
meanings.sent1: He was persuading his classmates to join the environmental club to help save the planet.
meanings.sent2: The speaker was persuading the audience to support his views on climate change.
meanings.sent3: The magician was persuading the audience to believe in magic with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The coach was persuading the team to adopt a winning mindset like a captain rallying his crew.
meanings.sent5: The artist was persuading the viewers to see the beauty in abstract art.
